sprites

Class Chest

  • java.lang.Object
    • sprites.Sprite
      • sprites.Chest

  • public class Chest
extends Sprite
    This class represents the chests the character can interact with to answer riddles.
    Version:
    5/14/22

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Chest(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      This creates a chest at the specified place in the coordinate grid and places it facing a certain direction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ansStatus(boolean hasAns)
      sets the status of the chest, i.e.
      void chooseRiddle(int num)
      Chooses a riddle out of the riddle bank
      boolean getStatus()
      returns the boolean status of the chest.
      RiddleBank returnRiddle()
      returns the riddle object within the chest

      • Methods inherited from class sprites.Sprite

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chest

        public Chest(int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height)
        This creates a chest at the specified place in the coordinate grid and places it facing a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the sprite
        y - the y-coordinate of the sprite

    • Method Detail

      • ansStatus

        public void ansStatus(boolean hasAns)
        sets the status of the chest, i.e. if chest has been opened, its status is changed to "true
        Parameters:
        hasAns - the boolean status of the chest you want to set

      • getStatus

        public boolean getStatus()
        returns the boolean status of the chest. True if it was opened, false if not
        Returns:
        the answered boolean status of the chest

      • chooseRiddle

        public void chooseRiddle(int num)
        Chooses a riddle out of the riddle bank
        Parameters:
        num - the number for the riddle chosen(riddles are numbered)

      • returnRiddle

        public RiddleBank returnRiddle()
        returns the riddle object within the chest
        Returns:
        the specific riddle object of the chest
